msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: WILLIAM CRUICKSHANK, called as a witness, being first sworn, testified as follows:
36 Q. What is your occupation? A. Hotel clerk
37 Q. Night or day clerk? A. Night.
38 Q. Do you recognise Mr. Pritchard here, the last witness? A. Yes sir
39 Q. How long has he been staying at your Hotel. A. Well I have been there since the 23rd of March and he was there previous to that, I guess
40 Q. He has been there to your knowledge since the 23rd of March? A. Yes
41 Q. Do you remember the night of the 4th of June? A. Yes sir
42 Q. What time did Mr. Pritchard come back to the Hotel on that night? A. Well it would be between 10:30 and 11 O'clock
43 Q. Alone or in company with anybody> A. Well I found him alone, but there had been, I was told, there where two fellows with him. He was alone when I found him.
44 Q. Where? A. In the hallway back of the office, between the toliet and the office.
45 Q. Was the bar still open then? A. The bar was still open
46 Q. How did you find Mr. Pritchard? A. He was incapable
47 Q. On the ground A. No he was standing up. He was leaning against the wall.
48 Q. And apparently drunk? A. Yes
49 Q. What did you do? A. I took him right up to bed
